values:
http://www.amiestreet.com/intothecage


 Have a listen, if you're interested. :)

So I stayed home today. Biological reasons and a cold, not particularly pleasant... Tried to sleep, couldn't sleep. So I watched TV and hung at the computer all day. Instead of being at school. That is indeed a nice feeling. Not like I missed much today anyway... Latin, Religion/Philosophy and Biology. *shrug* 

Mareike just invited me to her all-inclusive birthday celebration in March... that should be fun. I hardly see her anymore, but somehow we're still friends without talking. Nice girl... difficult life she has. Things seem to be getting better now though.

So tomorrow there's this presentation about Abi and then we get our report cards... easy day, then Thursday and Friday off. Can't wait till I'm in Leer again tomorrow noon. Don't feel at home anywhere but when I'm with Jan, as pathetic as that sounds.

Ugh. I can't recall why I agreed to join the roleplay Jan is in Wednesday nights over mIRC. Most of the people there are idiots and the story is... without any substance whatsoever. I'm amazed I'm somehow staying at it this whole evening. Full day of school again tomorrow... bah. Biology, German, English, History, two hours of each. Wish I could just stay home... although Friday I only have to be at school for two hours and can go straight to Leer afterwards. Have a lot to do Friday. Choir rehearsal, Doctor, ask the office for employment about becoming a Logopede (?) and ... and... go to the bank. Yes. That's about it, but it's still enough to fill an afternoon. Bah. I'm tired and wish I could just stay home tomorrow. And skip all of tomorrow if I had the choice... wah. At least I have off next Thursday and Friday. Huzzah.

I hate Sunday evenings, but at least I can spend them with Jan. Makes getting up the following morning not quite so difficult.

Jan's been downstairs for over 20 minutes speaking with his parents about helping me finance my driver's liscence since my parents decided not to... I'm missing 200 Euros which I have to have by Tuesday, and I don't have that kind of money nor the possibility to make it within six days... sorry folks... and Thursday night my glasses broke, and Benni is on vacation so I had to go find another glasses repair shop. Turned out they couldn't repair the frame (thank Heaven that's the only thing that was broken) and I had to buy a new one. The lady gave me a pair for 79 Euros instead of 189, but still, it's money I haven't got. And when I told my mother she said I had to pay for it. Nice. A few hours later she called back and told me she'd changed her mind because she'd misunderstood. Devil, can't she just pay attention properly for once?

Jan just came back... his parents are absolutely against him giving me the money, and think that I'll fail the driving test, and and and. They say I should get a job (where? and with what qualification? and when? I come home from school at 5pm, and I'm not in Leer regularly enough on weekends to have a regular job), and they wonder where the child support money goes to that my parents get. So do I. I'm at school all day, and on the weekend and during vacation I'm here. 

Oh right, I remember now. My parents planned the child support money into their new house. And they "need" me to go study so that they can keep paying for it.

As far as I care, they can go fuck themselves. They're my parents and it's their duty to make sure I have enough money for necessities, including food, school supplies and my liscence. And I hardly have enough money for the pill and to be able to see my boyfriend on the weekends. Things aren't at all turning out the way I'd hoped them to... and I wonder why they haven't. Until we moved everything was going well.

Every day I find myself wishing I could move out, move in with Jan. But I wouldn't be able to cover transportation costs to go to school (would total to about 100 Euros a month), and somehow his parents would have to support me, Jan and his sister Sarah who is studying medicine... I hardly think that that's an option.

Jan is done with school in spring. Then we'll see if we can't work anything out.

So I've removed everything and -one from my FL that I haven't had any contact with in the past year or more or who I just can't really remember. I doubt anyone will mind, it's not like I've been active lately.

Oh, what sad times are these when passing ruffians can say 'Alessy' at will to old ladies.

Which movie was this quote from?

Get your own quotes:

I've missed these toys. And I love what happened to this one.

Of all the alessy joints in all the towns in all the world, she walks into mine.

Which movie was this quote from?

Get your own quotes:

...it's been over a year now. Enough has happened to fill half a novel. Won't go into any of that now... I don't even expect anyone to read this.

Out of sentimentality... hello again.

Somehow I miss my old life. This... new one hasn't quite turned out the way I expected it to. Everything is working out beautifully with Jan and with school, but fucko - home life has taken a mighty turn since last year, since almost exactly one year ago. Maybe this is "adult life", or maybe this is just a friendly reminder of the fact that I want to get away from here as soon as possible. Don't even know what I want to do with my education... what good will it do me? Our job market hasn't seen a low like this in ages... I don't have particularly good chances of finding a job other than homemaker. Not quite what my goal was, but if it's at Jan's side, I'm willing to do it... with a smile on my face.

At least I don't need to fear about a roof over my head just yet.

So much to do, so little ambition, too much time... I wish Jan were here... evenings can be so cold and long.

All this just in, fresh from the press and still dripping ink!

Chor des UEG has received 2nd place in the choir competition of our Bundesland (state). Chances are we're moving up to the country-wide competition, too... we also won 200 Euros. Go us!

Off to bed now. Or... shower first, then bed. Good night, dream well, world.

The rest of the weekend and week are going to be extremely stressful, so anticipate silence. For a long time. Au revoir.

1. Name someone with the same birthday as you.
Don't know anyone.
2. Where was your first kiss?
First random kiss on Henne's terrace with three other people simultaneously. First real kiss behind the canisters and bike stand in the school yard.
3. Have you ever seriously vandalized someone else's property?
Just a bit of graffitti on school tables.
4. Have you ever hit someone of the opposite sex?
Sure.
5. Have you ever sung in front of a large number of people?
Yes, and I would love to do it again.
6. What's the first thing you notice about the preferred sex?
Posture. No, not figure.
7. What really turns you on?
Ask certain individuals and they may just tell.
8. What do you order at Starbucks?
If I actually had a Starbucks to go to, I'd order something along the lines of coffee.
9. What is your biggest mistake?
Not trusting myself.
10. Have you ever hurt yourself on purpose?
One time too often. One time too little.
11. Say something totally random about yourself.
Sometimes I wish I weren't blonde. Then I wish I were blonder.
12. Has anyone ever said you looked like a celebrity?
Juliet once told me I look like Miranda Otto. I was happy for 12 hours.
13. Do you still watch kiddy movies or tv shows?
I hardly ever watch television.
14. Did you have braces?
No.
15. Are you comfortable with your height?
Yes.
16. What is the most romantic thing someone of the opposite sex has done for you?
Hm. Couldn't say...
17. When do you know it's love?
When that one person is my one and only inspiration.
18. Do you speak any other languages?
English, German, French, Latin.
19. Have you ever been to a tanning salon?
No. Don't plan to.
20. What magazines do you read?
National Geographic now and then.
21. Have you ever ridden in a limo?
No. Seen a few though.
22. Has anyone you were really close to passed away?
Friends come and friends go.
23. Do you watch MTV?
Not since they turned for the worse.
24. What's something that really annoys you?
Telling me something I already know over and over.
25. What's something you really like?
Chess.
26. What celebrity do you admire?
I prefer not to admire celebrities.
27. Can you dance?
In certain states, yes.
28. What's the latest you have ever stayed up?
Going on 37 huors I think.
29. Ever lied to your parents as an adult?
Yes. If being 17 counts as an adult.
30. Have you ever been rushed by an ambulance into the emergency room?
Not to the emergency room.
31. Do you actually read these when other people fill them out?
Yes.

Your Sexy Halloween Costume Is
Cleopatra
What Sexy Halloween Costume Are You?

Talk about a busy life. I'm sorry I've not been keeping up with anything here, I have too much on my mind for a lifetime alone. But now life is starting to be as interesting as I wanted it to be. Sometimes giving up things that we love makes way for an existence we've been wanting.

Good luck to my dear friend Ian, may everything turn out well! *hugs* Knowing you, everything will one way or another... can't imagine you leaving us without a tormenter already. ;)

Going to Limit with Jan and Julia this evening, and have a practise day tomorrow for the choir competition. Which is in a week... I'm nervous and excited, and I think you can all guess which of those attributes I am more!

*sigh* Yes. Jan will be here any minute, so I better clean up a bit. Talk to all of you soon I hope.

Take this quiz at QuizGalaxy.com


Take this quiz at QuizGalaxy.com

So tired, so out of reality. Had one and a half homemade rolls too many, and now I'm paying for it. Have some homework to do, and a concert this evening. Really not feeling up to it, but I might feel better in a few hours.

Well, seems the fire started at a recycling company building and the winds carried the fumes into the city, so things aren't that bad. Julia is picking me up at 13.30 and then we're going out to town, where I can pick up some money, buy some espresso and some things at the local hippie store. At 16.00 I have choir practise (hurrah!) and I should be finished round 20.00 or 20.30 this evening. Then I'll be picked up by either my parents or Jan and be driven to his house for the party. Yes, today will be one of the best Saturdays in my life.

And the last few hours of last night were among the best hours of a Friday I've ever witnessed. But if I go into any detail, several of you *cough*Ian*cough* will surely go mad. So I shall spare the last bits of sanity... or destroy them, depending on how pedophilistic you all are! Muahahahaha!

Anyway, I'm off. I should get some lunch and then I should... I wanted to do something. Can't remember what. Ah well. Talk to you soon.

Apparently there's a nasty fire down in the city. I don't know exactly where, but apparently it's big... ambulances keep driving down the street along with fire trucks. We have to keep doors and windows shut, and Mum told me it might not be wise to walk to church (dress rehearsal for the concert tomorrow) this evening. Hm. More updates as they come in on that...

Again. I'm never quite pleased. More white this time, hopefully better to read.

Been doing a lot of thinking lately, about several topics in particular, nothing really that important though...

Good luck Ian, we know you'll be fine! *hugs* Just don't die without us. ;)

I never thought it would actually be true, but going out and acting like a hippie actually makes the world ten shades brighter. Felt like crap all day until this evening, when I went to the park with Bella. Jogged a bit, then sat down on a meadow for ten minutes or so, got a clear head, and came back feeling much refreshed. Yes, the world is good again.

Religious interest leaning into Hinduism again. I can never make up my mind... well, life is there for living. Wish I could just stick with something for more than six months though.
I feel like I don't belong here.

1. How tall are you? -- 172 cm
2. Do you own a gun? -- No.
3. Rehab? Counseling? -- Not currently.
4. Have you ever killed an animal? -- Enough insencts to fill a bucket of blood. A very small bucket.
5. Are you Irish? -- Partially.
6. What do you think of hot dogs? -- I don't like them particularly much.
7. What's your favorite Christmas song? -- Can't recall...
8. What is your favorite smell? -- Lavender?
9. What do you prefer to drink in the morning? -- Juice.
10. Do you do pushups? -- No.
11. Have you ever done ecstasy? -- Would if I had the chance to.
12. Have you ever been shot? -- No.
13. Have you ever been hospitalized? -- No.
14. Do you like painkillers? -- Yes.
15. What is your secret weapon to lure in the opposite sex? -- Hahaha.
16. Do you own a knife? -- Not me.
17. Do you have A.D.D? -- No.
18. Do you love the pain a tattoo brings? -- I might.
19. Name Five Drinks You Regularly Drink -- Coke, juice, water, chocolate milk, __.
20. What's In Your CD Player? -- Classical music.
21. What's Under Your Bed? -- Another mattress.
22. Current Hair? -- Dark blonde and shortish.
23. What are you wearing? -- Sweatpants, blue sweater.
24. Current Worry? -- Existence.
25. Current Love? -- Too much and too little...
26. Current Hate? -- I try not to.
27. Favorite Place To Be? -- Asleep.
28. Least Favorite Place To Be? -- With uncomfortable people.
29. If You Could Play an Instrument? -- Cello.
30. Favorite Colors? -- Black, red, blue.
31. Person(s) from your past you wish you could be with right now? -- Jenn.
32. Where Would You Like To Go? -- Heaven.
33. Where do you want to live? -- A good world.
34. Favorite food? So much...
35. Color of most clothes you own? -- Black.
36. Number of pillows you sleep with? -- Three.
37. What do you wear when you go to sleep? -- Always depends.
38. What were you doing 12AM last night? -- That is not PG13.
39. What do you think you'll be doing in 10 years? -- Living, perhaps.
40. Are you paranoid? -- Sometimes.
41. First piercing/tattoo? -- Ears at age 7 or so.
42. Last person you yelled at? -- Jan, in fun.
43. Latest crush? -- Three guesses.
44. Last thing you ate? -- Pizza.
45. If you could be a pirate, would you? -- Probably not.
46. Do you have an iPod? -- Wish I did.
47. When and why did you last vomit? -- Can't recall.
48. What's in your pockets right now? -- Lining.
49. What color are your bedroom walls? -- Peachish yellow.
50. Last thing that made you laugh? -- Jan yesterday.
51. Any pets now? -- Bella and Charlie.
52. Innie or an outtie? -- I am a born introvert.
53. Do you have any piercings? -- Ears.
54. If you were a crayon, what color would you be? Indigo.
55. Have you ever won any awards? -- Nothing worth mentioning.
57. Have you ever sprained/broken/fractured a bone or gotten stitches? -- Broke both my wrists and my left hand.
58. Who do you tell your dreams to? -- My friends and mother.
59. If you could pick one famous person to make out with who would it be? -- Angelina Jolie. Duh.
60. What do you think of the person who posted this before you? -- She has an interesting outlook on things.

All is well. All is good!

Oh the joys of being a teenager with terrible moodswings. *rolls eyes*

First Marc said he wanted the 'old Lessy' back. Now Chris said it. Both combined dealt a blow. What's wrong with the person I've become, I'm becoming?
"Everything."
I don't joke around as much, I see the world differently, I think differently. I like this me more. Secretly I hated the happy, somehow foolish, somehow deep child I was. Somehow I've become something so different over summer. So much more like I wanted to become. Maybe it was because I looked at my relatives and saw what I didn't want to become. I don't know. It doesn't really matter. I'm past the point where I will bend and break for someone. I've learned that the only way to really live is to stay true to yourself. That's what I intend to do. It's going to cost cuts and bruises. But I'm prepared for that.

...has life seemed as good as now, not in a few years anyway. I won't go into details here because I'm sure several people would have my head, so let's just say... life is good! Jan is a godsend. Just when I was preparing myself for another mind-breaking year, he showed up and proved me wrong. I couldn't thank him enough for that.

My eyes have been getting better and better for some reason. Without them I'm still a bit shortsighted, but now I'm shortsighted on both eyes, not just one and longsighted on the other. So I can actually do some things without my glasses (like updating lj!). Very nice.

I still have quite a lot of homework to do this afternoon... and I need to do something for math. Not that I really don't want to, I have the incentive, it's just that I have other things I'd rather be doing. Waking up completely would be one of them.

Odd. The newest entry on my LJ friends list is three days old. That has never happened before.


PS. Pandoraspassion is now going public.

Every day is so long I can hardly count the weeks anymore. Has it been one, has it been three? It's been two weeks now I think since I left the UEG. Oh yes, it was worth it, things are so much better. And through Jan I've become so much more self-loving, assured, happy, optimistic, creative. I've rediscovered my Muse, my love of language and expression. I could go on but dare not bore you. I need to make a new layout... I think the time is right for some more colour, wouldn't you agree? I haven't done more than my English homework today, I just can't be bothered... math is hardly important at the moment, and I couldn't find the page for Biology we were supposed to. Teachers, I swear... can't believe Jan wants to become one. I've been leaning more and more towards studying music. But for that I need piano lessons, my piano skills may be good, but not nearly good enough to gain acceptance to a music school. Music theory is so much more fascinating, it draws me in. Every music lesson I'm propelled into another world that I completely understand. Art theory... art is not theory for me, art is creation. Art is expression. Not theory, it can't be learned. You can, or you can't. That's all there is to it. We shall see. For now I need my Photoshop and Bach. Be back in no more than an hour with a new layout.

THREE NAMES YOU GO BY:
Alessandra, Lessy, Alessy

THREE SCREEN NAMES YOU HAVE HAD:
Alessy, The Cunning Linguist, The Photographer

THREE PHYSICAL THINGS YOU LIKE ABOUT YOURSELF:
My shape, my eyes, my voice.

THREE PHYSICAL THINGS YOU DON'T LIKE ABOUT YOURSELF:
My hands, my feet, my knees.

THREE PARTS OF YOUR HERITAGE:
German, English, Norwegian.

THREE THINGS THAT SCARE YOU:
Being forsaken, failing, spiders.

THREE OF YOUR EVERYDAY ESSENTIALS:
Music, thinking, computer.

THREE THINGS YOU ARE WEARING RIGHT NOW:
Necklace, spaghetti top, jeans.

THREE OF YOUR FAVORITE BANDS OR MUSICAL ARTISTS:
Bach, Rachmaninov, Placebo. What a mix.

THREE OF YOUR FAVORITE SONGS:
I couldn't tell you...

THREE THINGS YOU WANT IN A RELATIONSHIP:
Passion, respect, interest.

TWO TRUTHS AND A LIE (in no particular order):
I'm reading three books, I have a makeshift blue curtain, and I've removed the books from my shelf.

THREE PHYSICAL THINGS ABOUT THE PREFERRED SEX THAT APPEAL TO YOU:
Being able to hug something more than a sack of bones, voice, eyes.

THREE OF YOUR FAVORITE HOBBIES:
Art, playing piano and/or singing, philosophising with friends.

THREE THINGS YOU WANT TO DO REALLY BADLY RIGHT NOW:
I don't know, honestly...

THREE CAREERS YOU'RE CONSIDERING/YOU'VE CONSIDERED:
Psychiatrist (hah!), teacher, photographer.

THREE PLACES YOU WANT TO GO ON VACATION:
England, Scandinavia, Russia.

THREE KID'S NAMES YOU LIKE:
Lilith, Elisabeth, Lyla.

THREE THINGS YOU WANT TO DO BEFORE YOU DIE:
Have sex, be successful, be completely content.

THREE WAYS THAT YOU ARE STEREOTYPICALLY A GIRL:
I have a yellow room, I have a sense of fashion, and... not sure.

THREE WAYS THAT YOU ARE STEREOTYPICALLY A BOY:
I have no clue.

THREE PEOPLE THAT I WOULD LIKE TO SEE TAKE THIS QUIZ NOW:
Ian, Dixie, Chris.

Once upon a midnight dreary, while I websurfed, weak and weary,
...Over many a strange and spurious website of 'hot chicks galore',
...While I clicked my fav'rite bookmark, suddenly there came a warning,
...And my heart was filled with mourning, mourning for my dear amour.
..."'Tis not possible," I muttered, "give me back my cheap hardcore!" -
Quoth the server, "404".
